commitResults.messageTitle: Use Sets instead of Dictionaries for Page.includedFiles
commitResults.messageBody:
includedFiles is used to keep track of what pages
need to be rebuilt when a page is updated.

Previously, an object was used to do this:
`includedFiles[file] = true` if a file needs to be rebuilt
and
`includedFiles[file]` to check if the file needs to be rebuilt

But since ES6 there has been a more idiomatic way to do it with Sets:
`includedFiles.add(file)` if a file needs to be rebuilt
and
`includedFiles.has(file)` to check if the file needs to be rebuilt

commitResults.messageTitle: Use Sets instead of Dictionaries for builtFiles
commitResults.messageBody:
builtFiles is used to keep track of what pages
have already been built

Previously, an object was used to do this:
`builtFiles[file] = true` if a file has already been built
and
`builtFiles[file]` to check if the file has already been built

But since ES6 there has been a more idiomatic way to do it with Sets:
`builtFiles.add(file)` if a file has already been built
and
`builtFiles.has(file)` to check if the file has already been built

commitResults.messageTitle: Use Sets instead of Dictionaries for Site.baseUrlMap
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously, an object was used to do this:
`baseUrlMap[url] = true` if a url is a base url
and
`baseUrlMap[url]` to check if the url is a base url

But since ES6 there has been a more idiomatic way to do it with Sets:
`baseUrlMap.add(url)` if a url is a base url
and
`baseUrlMap.has(url)` to check if the url is a bse url

commitResults.messageTitle: Update tests to expect Sets instead of objects
commitResults.messageBody:
baseUrlMap, includedFiles, and builtFiles have all been updated,
and use Sets instead of Javascript objects to store information,
so the tests have been updated to expect the new data structure.

commitResults.messageTitle: Make Site.js default layout comply with eslint (#854)
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the default content in Site.js is not compliant
with the `no-undef` eslint rule.

A comment disabling the offended rule was added.

Since modals now support the center attribute,
let's update the user guide to reflect this.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update userGuide modal example to show actual code
commitResults.messageBody:
The user guide did not show the lorem ipsum text,
differing from the displayed output.

Let's update the code such that both the example code
and the example demo code are the same.

Some ids have to be changed, since there are two modals
that have the same id, causing the wrong modal to be displayed.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement footnotes via extended markdown syntax
commitResults.messageBody:
Plugin adapted from:
https://github.com/markdown-it/markdown-it-footnote

Using the above syntax, let's also show the footnote as a popover when
the link is hovered over.
Let's put footnotes syntax in formattingContents for easy discovery.

#short contents does not get rendered as markdown,
and causes the full syntax reference to break.

Let's add a newline before the relevant markdown code,
so that it does get rendered as markdown.

Since popovers already allow hovering over them, let's remove the
redundant trigger on a footnote popover.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add temp styles to panel to reduce FOUC (#927)
commitResults.messageBody:
Unexpanded panels show their content temporarily until Vue loads
completely.

Let's add some temp styles to panel tags that reduce this FOUC.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove anchor generation dependency on indexing level
commitResults.messageBody:
Anchor were only generated if the indexing level was greater than the
heading level, resulting in missing anchors and inconsistent behaviour

Change: Anchors are generated for all header tags, except those hidden
in panels

commitResults.messageTitle: Add npm script that run linters with the --fix tag (#853)
commitResults.messageBody:
Adds an npm script `autolint` to automatically perform easy 
fixes with the linters' built in functionality

Let's enhance the Box feature by adding support for a `dismissible`
attribute, which adds a close button to the box.

commitResults.messageTitle: Docs: Update Box user guide for `dismissible`

commitResults.messageBody:
To use an image as a thumbnail, we have to crop and rescale the image
by wrapping it in a div and using CSS. This can be especially
cumbersome with multiple images with different dimensions.

Let's add a built in feature that supports convenient creation of
thumbnails using a <thumb> tag. It only accepts one dimension attribute
`size`, rather than a separate `width` and `height`, and crops the
supplied image into a square or optionally a circle with minimal
hassle from the author.

Let's also extend that feature to also allow the author to supply text,
icons or emojis in place of an image.

commitResults.messageTitle: Docs: Add user guide entry for thumbnails

commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, there is a bug where an extra space appears after text
wrapped in a `tooltip` tag.

Let's fix that by removing the extra space

Markbind page authors can use diagrams in their sites by linking them
in a `<pic>` tag. This is tedious as it requires the author to generate
the diagrams using an external tool, and the binary files generated by
that tool (e.g. .pptx, .psd) are not version control friendly.

Let's support PlantUML, a tool that allows users to write diagrams in
a simple and intuitive language. Users can then write their diagrams
in a text editor, and Markbind will generate the diagrams using
PlantUML, eliminating the need of an external editor.

commitResults.messageTitle: Insert navbar temp styles after layout header
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously, a fix was implemented for reducing FOUC by applying
temporary styles for <navbar> and <dropdown>. A later commit broke this
fix by moving the header and footer files to a layout, which caused
the contents of those files to be missed by the temporary style fix.

This commit fixes this by inserting the temporary styles after
the header and footer files are inserted in the page, such that
the temporary styles are applied correctly to the relevant tags.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fixed puml diagrams for user guide (#917)
commitResults.messageBody:
Travis, the deployment tool does not have Graphviz installed, causing
the diagrams on markbind.org to fail to generate.

This commit changes them to normal `<pic>` tags, which work without
Graphviz

PlantUML plugin throws an error while trying to process diagrams
within an <include>. The original implementation resolves
diagram paths w.r.t. sourcePath rather than cwf.

sourcePath refers to the path of the file being processed
(in this case the file doing the include) and cwf refers to the file
being included.

This commit fixes that by preferring cwf where available (within
included file), and using sourcePath when cwf is unavailable
(within normal files).
